bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Motor Vehicle Act.
The fees set out in the Schedule are prescribed for the purposes of the Act.

oasis:entry.oasis:line: A registration fee for all vehicles registered under the Act, except as provided exemption in the Act, shall be payable at the time of initial registration. A registration fee shall also be charged for re-registration where the licence has been relinquished under section 20 of the Act

oasis:line.in:em: MOTOR VEHICLES OTHER THAN MOTORCYCLES OR MOTOR HOMES

oasis:entry.oasis:line: An annual licence fee for private passenger motor vehicles including station wagons, except as provided in conditional licences, based on a net weight:
An annual licence fee except as provided in conditional licences
An annual licence fee for a motor home, except as provided in conditional licences, based on a net weight:
An annual licence fee, except as provided in conditional licences, based on a gross vehicle weight:
An annual licence fee for each motor vehicle, excluding motorcycles, owned or leased by
a foreign state that has an office located in British Columbia,

a consular post, as defined in the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations, set out in Schedule II of the Foreign Missions and International Organizations Act (Canada), that has an office located in British Columbia,

an international organization that has been provided with privileges and immunities under section 5 of the Foreign Missions and International Organizations Act (Canada) and has an office located in British Columbia,

an office of a political subdivision of a foreign state that has been granted privileges and immunities under section 6 of the Foreign Missions and International Organizations Act (Canada) and is located in British Columbia, or
a foreign representative or the spouse or a dependent of a foreign representative if

the foreign representative, spouse or dependent is resident in British Columbia and is not a Canadian citizen or permanent resident, as defined in the Immigrant and Refugee Protection Act (Canada), and

in relation to an office referred to in clauses (A) to (D), the foreign representative, spouse or dependent has been granted privileges, immunities or benefits under the Foreign Missions and International Organizations Act (Canada) that have not been withdrawn

An annual licence fee for each motor vehicle, trailer or motorcycle, owned or leased exclusively by a municipality, regional district or school district as defined by the School Act or by an organization comprised solely of municipalities, regional districts, regional libraries or school districts
An annual licence fee for each motor vehicle or trailer, but excluding motorcycles, used exclusively for fire protection purposes
An annual licence fee for each motor vehicle, trailer or motorcycle owned by Canada
An annual licence fee for each motor vehicle or trailer, excluding motorcycles, owned or leased and operated exclusively by a charitable organization in carrying out its work
An annual licence fee for each motor vehicle or trailer, excluding motorcycles, owned by joint international commissions, or by government of another province or state or its agencies
An annual licence fee for each motor vehicle or trailer owned by a volunteer rescue group and used exclusively for search and rescue programs
The licence fee for each antique motor vehicle or motorcycle
The licence fee for each collector motor vehicle or motorcycle

oasis:line.in:em: VEHICLES OF UNUSUAL SIZE, WEIGHT OR OPERATING CHARACTERISTICS, EXCLUDING NEIGHBOURHOOD ZERO EMISSION VEHICLES

oasis:entry.oasis:line: The licence fee for each vehicle, unless a lower fee is provided for under item 2 (e)
Annual licence fee, which shall entitle the holder of the licence to one distinctive number plate
For each additional distinctive number plate issued with the licence, a fee of
For each substitution of a transporter number plate issued with the licence, a fee of
For an annual demonstration licence respecting motor vehicles and trailers generally, a fee of
The payment of the fee entitles the holder of the licence to the use of one number plate and to operate one motor vehicle or trailer at one time.
For an annual demonstration licence respecting motorcycles and/or trailers only, a fee of
The payment of the fee entitles the holder of the licence to the use of one number plate and to operate one motorcycle or trailer at one time.
For each substitution of a demonstration number plate issued with the licence, a fee of
Annual licence fee, which shall entitle the holder of the licence to one distinctive number plate
For each additional distinctive number plate issued with the licence, a fee of
For each substitution of a manufacturer's number plate issued with the licence, a fee of
Annual licence fee, which shall entitle the holder of the licence to one distinctive number plate
For each additional distinctive number plate issued with the licence, a fee of
For each substitution of a repairperson's number plate issued with the licence, a fee of
The fee for a driver's licence is as follows:
For a driver's licence issued for more than 4 years
For a driver's licence issued for 4 years or less, other than a learner's licence
For a driver's licence issued for a person 65 years of age or older, other than a learner's licence
For a duplicate of a driver's licence, other than a learner's licence

oasis:line.in:em: DRIVERS' LICENCES WITH INDICATION OF CANADIAN CITIZENSHIP

oasis:entry.oasis:line: For a driver's licence referred to in item 4 (a) (i), (ii), (iii) or (v) with indication of Canadian citizenship
For a driver's licence referred to in item 4 (a) (iv) or (vi) with indication of Canadian citizenship
For an upgrade from a driver's licence to a driver's licence with indication of Canadian citizenship outside the renewal cycle, other than a learner's licence
For an upgrade from a learner's licence to a learner's licence with indication of Canadian citizenship outside the renewal cycle

oasis:line.in:em: DRIVERS' TEST AND MISSED TEST FEES

oasis:entry.oasis:line: For all knowledge tests or retests taken at one time, or each test or retest taken separately
Subject to subparagraph (vii), for each road test, or retest requiring an individual to demonstrate the individual's ability to drive and operate a motor vehicle
Subject to subparagraph (viii), for each practical air brake test or retest, if conducted separately from a road test
Subject to subparagraph (ix), for each practical pre-trip test or retest, if conducted separately from a road test or practical air brake test or retest
Subject to subparagraph (x), any test or retest for a person 65 years of age or older
Subject to subparagraph (xi), any test or retest for a person directed by the superintendent to take that test

For each road test or retest requiring an individual to demonstrate the individual's ability to drive and operate a motor vehicle, if the person being tested has failed to attend a road test or retest, practical pre-trip test or retest or practical air brake test or retest scheduled during the previous 3 years without
providing 48 hours' notice of cancellation to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, or
providing the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia with a reason that is satisfactory to it for the failure to attend

For each practical air brake test or retest conducted separately from a road test, if the person being tested has failed to attend a practical air brake test or retest, practical pre-trip test or retest or road test or retest scheduled during the previous 3 years without
providing 48 hours' notice of cancellation to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, or
providing the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia with a reason that is satisfactory to it for the failure to attend

For each practical pre-trip test or retest, conducted separately from a road test or practical air brake test or retest, if the person being tested failed to attend a practical pre-trip test or retest, practical air brake test or retest, or road test or retest scheduled during the previous 3 years without
providing 48 hours' notice of cancellation to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, or
providing the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia with a reason that is satisfactory to it for the failure to attend

For each road test or retest, practical air brake test or retest conducted separately from a road test, or practical pre-trip test or retest conducted separately from a road test or practical air brake test or retest respecting a person 65 years of age or older, if the person being tested has failed to attend a road test or retest, practical pre-trip test or retest, or practical air brake test or retest scheduled during the previous 3 years without
providing 48 hours' notice of cancellation to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, or
providing the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia with a reason that is satisfactory to it for the failure to attend, a fee of

For each road test or retest, practical air brake test or retest conducted separately from a road test, or practical pre-trip test or retest conducted separately from a road test or practical air brake test or retest, for a person directed by the superintendent to take that test, if the person being tested has failed to attend a road test or retest, practical pre-trip test or retest, or practical air brake test or retest scheduled during the previous 3 years without
providing 48 hours' notice of cancellation to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, or
providing the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia with a reason that is satisfactory to it for the failure to attend, a fee of
Nothing in item 4 (b) (vii) to (xi) means that a person must pay for any one missed test more than once

oasis:line.in:em: COMMERCIAL DRIVER MEDICAL EXAMINATION PROCESSING FEE

oasis:entry.oasis:line: The fee for processing medical examinations on issuance of a driver's licence, if the driver's licence is not or will not be used exclusively by the driver for unpaid, volunteer purposes, is as follows:
for a duplicate driver's licence when the purpose of the duplicate is to upgrade a Driver's Licence Class 5 to a Driver's Licence Class 1, 2, 3, or 4

for Driver's Licence Class 5 endorsed to permit the operation of single trucks with air brakes on industrial roads, truck trailers with air brakes on industrial roads, or truck trailers of any gross vehicle weight without air brakes

for a duplicate driver's licence when the purpose of the duplicate is to add an endorsement to permit the operation of single trucks with air brakes on industrial roads, truck trailers with air brakes on industrial roads, or truck trailers of any gross vehicle weight without air brakes
For a number plate issued under the Act, excluding a personalized number plate, a BC Parks number plate and a number plate issued with a special licence, a fee of
Substitution of number plates or decals under section 51 of the Act, excluding special licences, a fee of
For transfer of title or licence under section 17 of the Act
For transfer of a salvage vehicle under section 17.1 (3) of the Act
For transfer of irreparable (dismantle only) vehicle under section 17.1 (3) of the Act
For filing a notice of vehicle status change (salvage) under section 17.1 (4) of the Act
For a duplicate of any permit issued under the Act, a fee of
For the filing of proof of financial responsibility under section 106 of the Act, a fee of
Notwithstanding subparagraph (i), for one number plate that may be used on 2 or more collector motor vehicles, a fee of
For a substitution of the plate referred to in subparagraph (vii), a fee of
Surcharge for a short term licence, a fee of
For an Air Brake manual, a fee of
For a B.C. assigned vehicle identification number, a fee of
For a new driver manual ("Tuning Up"), a fee of
For a safety certificate, a non-refundable application fee of

Fees for searching the records maintained by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia or the superintendent and for furnishing copies of records or documents in the custody of the corporation or the superintendent shall be as set out in paragraphs (a) and (b).

No fee shall be charged to a department, board or commission of the government of the Province, a municipality, regional district, or any police department, for searches or copies of records or documents to be used for a public purpose. No fee shall be charged to the South Coast British Columbia Transportation Authority, or to a subsidiary or a billing organization, as those terms are defined in the South Coast British Columbia Transportation Authority Act, or to a concessionaire or a billing organization, as those terms are defined in the Transportation Investment Act, for searches or copies of records or documents they are respectively entitled to under the South Coast British Columbia Transportation Authority Act or the Transportation Investment Act. No fee shall be charged to the administrator as defined in the Unclaimed Property Act, or the authority as defined in the Motor Dealer Act, for electronic searches undertaken by the administrator or the authority in fulfilling their mandates under the Unclaimed Property Act or the Motor Dealer Act.
In the interests of traffic safety, the corporation or the superintendent may, for each copy of a driver's record or document obtained by an employer with the employee's consent, waive the fee.
The fee for a search referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) shall be multiplied by the number of names or vehicles which are searched.
For a search for current ownership, name only
For a search for current ownership, name and address only
For a search for ownership as of a specific date, name and address only
For a search for ownership when performed through an electronic device authorized by an agreement between the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia and an individual, name only
For a search for ownership when performed through an electronic device authorized by an agreement between the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia and an individual, name and address only

The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may make arrangements with any person for allowing such person to receive lists of names of owners and descriptions of motor vehicle and trailer licences issued under the Act for the Province, and the fee for the particulars of the name of each owner and description shall be
For each copy of a record or document
For each certified abstract or certified copy of a document
For a search for current ownership, when no record is found
For a search of current ownership, name and address only, for vehicle safety recalls
For each copy of a record or document, whether certified or not
The fee for a temporary operation permit under section 14.02 of B.C. Reg. 26/58 shall be
The fee for a temporary operation permit under section 14.03 of B.C. Reg. 26/58 shall be 8% of the annual licence fee for the vehicle to the nearest dollar.
Subject to section 14.04 of B.C. Reg. 26/58, the minimum fee for any permit issued under this Act or regulation shall be
The fees for licences issued or renewed, or tests conducted pursuant to Division 27 of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations are
for each annual Driver Training School Licence
for an additional or duplicate Driver Training School Licence
for each Driver Training Instructor's Licence issued for 2 years
for an additional or duplicate Driver Training Instructor's Licence
for each driver training instructor knowledge test
for each driver training instructor practical test
The fee for each original or renewal personalized number plate and for the initial issuance of a personalized number plate
The fee for each annual renewal of a personalized number plate
The fee for each replacement of a personalized number plate

oasis:line.in:strong: VEHICLE INSPECTION FEES (Division 25 of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations)

oasis:entry.oasis:line: for designation of an inspection facility other than a facility designated solely for inspecting motorcycles
for renewal of a designation other than a facility designated solely for inspecting motorcycles
for designation of a facility designated solely for the inspection of motorcycles
for renewal of a designation of a facility designated solely for inspecting motorcycles
for first conditional exemption under the provisions of the Preventative Maintenance Program
for each exemption subsequent to the exemption referred to in paragraph (c)
for Vehicle Inspection Manual (containing the standards of safety and repair prescribed by the minister under section 217 of the Motor Vehicle Act)
for the initial issuance of an authorized person identification card
for each two year renewal of an authorized person identification card
for the initial issuance and annual renewal of a designated inspection facility identification plate
for each replacement of an authorized person identification card for change of card information or for lost, stolen or damaged card
for each replacement of a designated inspection facility identification plate for change of plate information or for lost, stolen or damaged plate
For a new BC identification card a fee of
For a renewal of a BC identification card a fee of
For a BC identification card for a person 65 years of age or older a fee of
For a duplicate of a BC identification card a fee of

For a BC identification card issued to a person who is voluntarily surrendering a driver's licence, except if the licence is surrendered because the driver has failed to comply with requirements that relate to the cancellation of a driver's licence or that relate to an order of prohibition

For renewal of a BC identification card by a recipient of income assistance, youth allowance or disability allowance under the BC Benefits (Income Assistance) Act, BC Benefits (Youth Works) Act or Disability Benefits Program Act

oasis:line.in:strong: BC IDENTIFICATION CARD WITH INDICATION OF CANADIAN CITIZENSHIP

oasis:entry.oasis:line: For a BC identification card referred to in item 12 (a), (b), (c), (e) or (f) with indication of Canadian citizenship
For a BC identification card referred to in item 12 (d) with indication of Canadian citizenship
For an upgrade from a BC identification card to a BC identification card with indication of Canadian citizenship outside the renewal cycle

For a BC identification card with indication of Canadian citizenship issued to a person who is voluntarily surrendering a driver's licence with indication of Canadian citizenship, except if the licence is surrendered because the driver has failed to comply with requirements that relate to the cancellation of a driver's licence or that relate to an order of prohibition

For a BC identification card with indication of Canadian citizenship issued to a person who is voluntarily surrendering a driver's licence, except if the licence is surrendered because the driver has failed to comply with requirements that relate to the cancellation of a driver's licence or that relate to an order of prohibition
Subject to item 5 (iii) and paragraph (b), the fee for each BC Parks number plate issued under the Act

The fee for each BC Parks number plate issued under the Act as a substitute for a previously issued number plate, unless the previously issued number plate was a BC Parks number plate with the same background as the BC Parks number plate for which the BC Parks number plate is being substituted
The fee for each annual renewal of a BC Parks number plate

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Motor Vehicle Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 318, ss. 23, 25, 62 (1), 210, 212 and 216 (1).]
